author: Omar Rashid
text:
‘People unable to believe that the policy is not under threat’

Lashing out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his stance on reservation, Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Friday said despite the PM’s repeated attempts to clarify on the issue, it has become impossible for people to believe that the reservation policy is not under threat.

The former Chief Minister said Mr. Modi’s stance on the reservation was comparable to the “jumlabaazi” of the promise of bringing back black money and the ushering in “Acche din” by the NDA government.

Whenever the RSS’s “casteist and controversial statements” appeared on the issue of reservation, Mr. Modi sought to clarify that reservation was the “right of Dalits” and no one could snatch it from them, Ms. Mayawati said. However, in reality, she said the BJP and the Congress governments had through a conspiracy deemed the policy “ineffective,” she said. A key constitutional right of the Dalits, the reservation were reduced to something only on paper and being cosmetic, she said. The Congress and the BJP governments were not honest in implementing the policy as part of a conspiracy, but were today talking of the review of reservations, she alleged.

The RSS-BJP’s Hindutvavadi mentality was clearly reflected through its stance on reservations, she said. She urged the BJP to seek forgiveness from the real children of “Bharat Mata,” the Dalits and backwards for the oppression faced by them and non implementation of the quota policy in its true spirit.
title: Mayawati attacks Modi’s stance on quota
